p: Clinical chemistry studies have shown increases in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alanine transaminase (ALT), C-reactive protein (CRP), creatine kinase (CK), erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), white blood cell (WBC) count, D-dimer level, procalcitonin, urea, and creatinine. Decreases in hemoglobin, lymphocyte count, eosinophil count, and serum albumin have been detected in COVID-19 patients [17].
